sentences.en: Are you all right, old chap?
Calm down, buddy [ old chap ] . What's the trouble?
sentences.cn: 压压气, 老兄. 有什么麻烦 吗 ?

sentences.en: Good - bye , old chap, I'll see you on my return.
sentences.cn: 再见 吧, 老伙计, 等我回来再见面.

sentences.en: He isn't such a bad chap really.
sentences.cn: 他这个家伙并不真的这么坏。

sentences.en: He was an immensely likeable chap.
sentences.cn: 他是个极讨人喜欢的家伙。

sentences.en: He's not a bad chap—quite human for an accountant.
sentences.cn: 这个家伙人不坏——就会计来说已经很有人情味了。

sentences.en: Martin is a quiet, contemplative sort of chap.
sentences.cn: 马丁是个不爱讲话、喜欢沉思默想的小伙子。

sentences.en: Poor chap— he was killed in an air crash.
sentences.cn: 不幸的家伙，他死于空难。

sentences.en: That chap is really difficult to deal with.
The chap is a good - for - nothing.
This chap likes to exaggerate and is good at nothing but boasting.
sentences.cn: 这个人言过其实,就会吹牛皮放大炮.

sentences.en: This young chap is very tall.
Today the best tests are performed in the hospital .see chap. 17..
sentences.cn: 现在，本医院可提供最好的化验（见第17章）。

words.tran_cn: 裂开（chap的过去式和过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: [主英国口语][用作招呼语]老兄，老伙计，老弟[亦称作 old boy， old fellow]

trans.tran_cn: （对男子的友好称呼）家伙，伙计
trans.tran_en: a man, especially a man you know and like
(of the skin) to make or become raw and cracked, esp by exposure to cold
